problem.display_name: The nine-qubit quantum error correction code
problem.p: This is a concept question, provided to check your understanding of the previous video clip.
Which of the following statements about the the nine-qubit Shor code are correct? Check all that apply:

choice.text: The nine-qubit code encodes one qubit and corrects both bit- and phase-flip errors on any single qubit.
The nine-qubit code is a concatenation of two three-qubit codes.
The nine-qubit code corrects bit- and phase-flip errors, but not both.
The nine-qubit code corrects bit- and phase-flip errors, but not arbitrary single qubit rotations.
The nine-qubit code corrects a single qubit depolarizing channel error.
